topic: How to type-check stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to type-check stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Type-checking Stream Processing with FastAPI in Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This guide demonstrates how to implement type checking for stream processing in FastAPI applications using Python 3.12+. We will create an endpoint that accepts a stream of JSON data and validates it against specified types.",

  "key_points": [
    "Leverage Pydantic and FastAPI for type-checking and validation",
    "Use the `receive` function to accept streams in FastAPI",
    "Stream processing involves iteratively reading, transforming, and writing data"
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\
from fastapi import FastAPI, WebSocket,\n     Depends\n\
from pydantic import BaseModel\n\
app = FastAPI()\n\
class Data(BaseModel):\n    value: int\n\nws = app.websocket(\"/ws/\")\ndef get_ws(Depends(ws)):\n    async def receive(self, data: bytes):\n        parsed_data = json.loads(data)\n        data_obj = Data(**parsed_data)\n        # Perform your stream processing here\n\nif __name__ == \"__main__\":\n    app.run()\n```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "Python 3.12+ is required for this implementation",
    "FastAPI and Pydantic must be installed via pip"
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "Ensure the received data is properly formatted as JSON",
    "Manage stream processing and validation errors appropriately in your application"
  ]
}
